dt: {bc}from a definite past time until now

et: Middle English {it}sins{/it}, contraction of {it}sithens{/it}, from {it}sithen{/it}, from Old English {it}siththan{/it}, from {it}sīth tham{/it} after that, from {it}sīth{/it} after, late + {it}tham{/it}, dative of {it}thæt{/it} that; akin to Old High German {it}sīd{/it} later and perhaps to Latin {it}setius{/it} to a lesser degree
shortdef: from a definite past time until now
after a time in the past : subsequently

dt: {bc}at a time in the past after or later than

dt.t: has held two jobs {wi}since{/wi} he graduated

dt: {bc}from the time in the past when

dt.t: {wi}since{/wi} it was raining she took an umbrella

shortdef: at a time in the past after or later than : from the time in the past when
in view of the fact that : because

dt: {bc}in the period after a specified time in the past {bc}from a specified time in the past

shortdef: in the period after a specified time in the past : from a specified time in the past

dt.t: The house was built in 1919. {it}Since that time{/it}, it has changed owners several times.

shortdef: from that time to the present

dt.t: The company started as a small local business 10 years ago and has grown a lot {it}since then{/it}.

dt: {bc}for a very long time {bc}since a time in the distant past

dt.t: That monument has been there {it}since the year dot{/it}.

shortdef: for a very long time : since a time in the distant past

dt: {bc}for a very long time {bc}since a time in the distant past

dt.t: That monument has been there {it}since the year one{/it}.

shortdef: for a very long time : since a time in the distant past

dt.t: People have been creating art {it}since time immemorial{/it}.

dt: used to show that one is surprised and often angry, annoyed, or doubtful about what someone has said or done

dt.t: "You told me to do it." "{it}Since when{/it} did you start listening to me?"
{it}Since when{/it} is it okay to cheat?

shortdef: —used to show that one is surprised and often angry, annoyed, or doubtful about what someone has said or done
